greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of smallest parts of all partitions of n into odd distinct parts.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum((2*n-1)*x^(2*n-1)*Product(1+x^(2*k+1), k = n .. infinity), n = 1 .. infinity).
example: a(13)=15 because the partitions of 13 into distinct odd parts are [13],[9,3,1] and [7,5,1], with sum of the smallest terms 13+1+1=15.
mathematica: nmax = 60; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Sum[(2*k - 1)*x^(2*k - 1) * Product[1 + x^(2*j + 1), {j, k, nmax}], {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 28 2016 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 15 2004
